name: INSTARCloud
0:
”Alexa, show me camera name”
”Alexa, launch INSTAR Cloud”
”Alexa, start INSTAR Cloud”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: instar cloud
Developer Terms of Use
des:
The INSTAR Cloud Skill lets you watch alarm videos from your INSTAR IP camera directly on your Alexa device (only devices with a display are supported). To use this skill, it is necessary, that you have a INSTAR Cloud account which you can register at https://cloud.instar.de
After you set up your camera to upload alarm videos into the INSTAR Cloud, you will then be able to use Alexa to display alarms based on certain filters, for example you can ask to show only the recent alarms, display recordings with a person, vehicle or animal or play all alarms of a particular camera.
This skill also allows you to check some account information such as the amount of storage space available, the amount of cameras in your account and other information. 

Some examples how to use this skill are:

Connecting
Before you give a command, you have to connect to the Cloud, this you do by saying:
“Alexa, open INSTAR Cloud”
“Alexa, start INSTAR Cloud”

Latest Recordings
“Alexa, show me the latest alarms”
“Alexa, play the latest videos”

Latest Alarms (amount x) from particular camera name (x)
“Alexa, show the latest 10 alarms from camera entrance”
“Alexa, play the 5 latest videos from camera courtyard”

Alarms on specific date
“Alexa, show me all alarms from March 28th 2020”
“Alexa, play videos from December 24th 2019”

Check available storage space
“Alexa, how much space is left on my cloud”
“Alexa, how much memory is still available”

Exit
“Alexa, exit”
“Alexa, exit INSTAR Cloud”

For more examples please visit http://acs.instar.com

Important information:
- Make sure that you name your camera in a simple way that Alexa understands, this is the name you set inside the INSTAR Cloud.
- Each camera name should be unique and different from other existing camera names to make sure Alexa knows which camera you mean.
- Follow our examples in order to give commands to Alexa, even so Alexa should understand different variations of saying the command, there might be some ways that Alexa will not know what the command is.

For the detailed information on how to use this skill, please also check: http://acs.instar.com

Note: This skill requires account linking. If you have multiple accounts in the INSTAR Cloud, Alexa will only enable and link this skill to the account that is currently logged in or linked.
